job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) II in Williamsburg, VA
pros:
Small company with opportunities to increase skills related to behavioral health and individuals with intellectual disabilities. 
Responsive management, mostly open to recommendations regarding the needs of the group home and the health and safety of its residents.
Managed the COVID-19 pandemic well.
cons:
Low pay.
Minimal room for professional growth in the residential department.

review_title: Important Mission Undercut by Toxic Work Environment
pros:
Health/Dental Insurance.
Multiple Locations in Virginia.
cons:
Rampant Unprofessionalism.
A training program that is incomplete to the point of being in shambles.
Management that is either hostile or absent.

pros: No pros to working for this agency

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Williamsburg, VA
pros: I liked most of my coworkers! Very good benefits. Commitment to community was nice.
cons: Middle management turned over often and personality conflicts among them made working there difficult. Salaries were too low/not competitive at the time but heard they are doing much better.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Williamsburg, VA
pros: To get the experience you need.
cons: Poor poor communication skills between coordinator and manager. They don't care about staff needs. Coordinator is rude don't speak. They pick and choose what staff they want to be bothered with. Staff feel they are not appreciated. Really your family doesn't matter. So sad

pros:
Decent pay
Being able to help families
Progress of clients
Consistent schedule, decent pay and benefits
cons: Too much paperwork, assigned clients without being told, manager/coordinator too friendly with probation/parole officers and would be inconsistent with how therapists handle group rule issues. manager/coordinator would be inconsistent with policy especially how it effected clients, manager/coordinator would focus on unimportant things and miss very important things.

pros: The benefits were standard for a community service board.
cons:
The environment was incredibly toxic.  I understand that employees go to work to get a paycheck and not to make friends.  However people were generally nasty towards one another.

The training was abysmal and did not prepare staff for their assigned duties.   The electronic medical record used was not easy to understand and management did not encourage staff to ask questions, compounding the issue.

job_title: Community Services Associate II in Williamsburg, VA
pros: Educational Reimbursements, longevity in positions, opportunities for cross training and overtime sometimes available
cons: Limited growth within departments and lateral moves blocked based on companies best interest.

pros: , Decent pay, good location, company car and cell phone, flexible schedule, a good amount of vacation time and sick leave
cons: Lack of support, poor management, heavy work load, did I mention lack of support. Responsible for all clients needs. No annual pay increase
